data.name: Time is money (Art thou part of the succession 'nombrer'?)
data.description:
From the series Time Is Money, where I extrapolate the 13th commandment of PEP 20. Your function should be able to read any given Integer > 0 and say whether or not that number belongs in a sequence (I personally call, **The Atone Sequence** (Atonen Sequentia)) and return the position of that given number in The Atone Sequence. (see https://gist.github.com/shimon-d/20ec381f8865eb55311328dbb56d5462)


But first, what is this so called Atone Sequence:


1 + 2 = 3

3 + (2 * 2) = 7

7 + (2 * 2 * 2) = 15

15 + (2 * 2 * 2 * 2) = 31

31 + (2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2) = 63

63 + (2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2) = 127

Which is also to say:

(2â¿) - 1

Having that in mind consider the following:

`1 -> 1st`\
`3 -> 2nd`\
`7 -> 3rd`

Given the input -> `63`
Your code should return the following `string`:

'6th'

A. That number belongs in the Atone Sequence\
B. The number position in the sequence is (in ordinal numbers) the 6th

Any number out of the sequence and your function should return 'nope'

Tests of numbers up to 99 ^ 9999 are going to take place. Make sure your code is efficient not to time out.


### Time Is Money Series
[Number Of Operations](https://www.codewars.com/kata/636b03830ae6cd00388cd228)
